name: Mounts & Vehicles
description: Mounts, vehicles, tack, harness, and drawn vehicles from the SRD

items.name: Camel
items.description: A desert mount known for endurance. Can go long periods without water.

items.name: Donkey
items.description: A sturdy beast of burden, slower but reliable.

items.name: Mule
items.description: A hybrid of horse and donkey, known for stubbornness and sure-footedness.

items.name: Elephant
items.description: A massive mount used in exotic lands. Requires special training to ride.

items.name: Draft Horse
items.description: A large horse bred for heavy labor and pulling vehicles.

items.name: Riding Horse
items.description: A standard horse suitable for travel and light riding.

items.name: Warhorse
items.description: A horse trained for combat. Will not flee from battle and can attack.

items.name: Mastiff
items.description: A large dog that can serve as a mount for Small creatures or as a guard animal.

items.name: Pony
items.description: A smaller horse suitable for Small riders or as a pack animal.

items.name: Barding
items.description: Armor for a mount. Cost and weight are multiplied from the base armor type. Barding takes twice as long to put on as normal armor.

items.name: Bit and Bridle
items.description: Essential equipment for controlling a mount.

items.name: Carriage
items.description: An enclosed four-wheeled vehicle pulled by horses. Can carry passengers in comfort.

items.name: Cart
items.description: A simple two-wheeled vehicle for transporting goods. Pulled by a single draft animal.

items.name: Chariot
items.description: A two-wheeled vehicle designed for speed and combat. Pulled by horses.

items.name: Animal Feed (1 day)
items.description: Feed for a horse or similar mount for one day.

items.name: Saddle, Exotic
items.description: A specialized saddle for unusual mounts such as aquatic or flying creatures.

items.name: Saddle, Military
items.description: A saddle that braces the rider, giving advantage on checks to remain mounted.

items.name: Saddle, Pack
items.description: A saddle designed for carrying equipment rather than a rider.

items.name: Saddle, Riding
items.description: A standard saddle for riding a mount.

items.name: Saddlebags
items.description: Bags that attach to a saddle for carrying equipment.

items.name: Sled
items.description: A vehicle for traveling over snow and ice, pulled by dogs or similar animals.

items.name: Stabling (1 day)
items.description: The cost of stabling a mount at a stable for one day, including food and care.

items.name: Wagon
items.description: A four-wheeled vehicle for transporting heavy loads. Requires draft animals to pull.

items.name: Galley
items.description: A large ship propelled by sails and oars. Often used for war or trade.

items.name: Keelboat
items.description: A small riverboat with a pointed bow, suitable for inland waterways.

items.name: Longship
items.description: A long, narrow ship designed for speed and raiding. Can navigate shallow waters.

items.name: Rowboat
items.description: A small boat propelled by oars. Suitable for crossing rivers or short distances.

items.name: Sailing Ship
items.description: A large merchant vessel with sails for long ocean voyages.

items.name: Warship
items.description: A heavily armed naval vessel designed for combat at sea.
